episodes.title: Many children of faith healing families are buried in this cemetery
episodes.description: Since 2005, 11 children have died in families who are Followers of Christ. Many are buried in Peaceful Valley Cemetery. Read more about faith healing in Idaho. https://www.idahostatesman.com/news/politics-government/state-politics/article239676853.html

episodes.title: Linda Martin
episodes.description:
Linda Martin grew up in a multi-generational, faith-healing cult.  She watched children be born and die slow suffering deaths; the parents never charged, allowed in Idaho to utilize a freedom of religious defense. She left the cult in 2013, and now she is speaking out.  

Guest: Linda Martin: https://www.facebook.com/groups/silentvictims

Hostess: Vennie Kocsis: http://venniekocsis.com

episodes.title: Idaho worst in nation for faith healing deaths
episodes.description: More children die due to faith-based medical neglect in Idaho than in any other state. Today, advocates for children discussed ways to develop legislation to change that.

episodes.title: Faith Healing laws up for discussion
episodes.description: In 1972 Idaho passed a law allowing parents with religious objections to medical treatment to have the the legal right to let their children die without seeking any medical attention. It's now a concern brought forward by The Governor's Task Force on Children at Risk, and a law some Idaho officials say needs to be changed.

episodes.title: Fatal Faith: To see kids die without any care....
Religious sect shuns doctor, children pay the price
episodes.description:

episodes.title: Children of Faith Healers Dying
episodes.description: Since 2011 -  12 children have been buried at Peaceful Valley Cemetery outside of Boise, ID. Reporter Dan Tilkin documents how their graves joined DOZENS of other children buried nearby that have died likely because their parents won't take them to a doctor. They belong to a faith healing church called The Followers of Christ in Idaho. Idaho is one of the last places in the U.S. where a parent won't be prosecuted if their parents rely on faith healing. A branch of the Followers of Christ exists in Oregon City. After dozens of children who belong to that church died, Oregon changed its laws to protect kids. Four sets of parents were prosecuted. Meanwhile, efforts to change the law in Idaho keep getting thwarted.

episodes.title: Letting Your Kids Die Is Okay If It's For Faith
episodes.description:
An Idaho Republican said a proposed ban on faith-healing could violate the religious rights of her constituents – many of whom eschew medical care for themselves and their families...

Read More At:
http://www.rawstory.com/rs/2015/02/idaho-republican-backs-faith-healer-parents-if-i-want-to-let-my-child-be-with-god-why-is-that-wrong/

episodes.title: Going beyond faith
episodes.description: Mike Sharp has both sides of the debate over a newly proposed bill at the Idaho Statehouse attempting to hold faith healers accountable for injuries and deaths of children.

episodes.title: Dan Sevy on faith healing
episodes.description: Dan Sevy is seen here on Aug. 4, 2016, telling legislators about the importance of allowing citizens to practice faith healing in Idaho.

episodes.title: Linda Martin on faith-healing exemptions
episodes.description: Linda Martin left the Followers of Christ church as a teen. Over the years she's attended dozens of funerals of people she believes died from lack of medical care due to the church's belief in "spiritual treatment," or faith healing. The dead include many children whose parents would not take them to a doctor.

episodes.title: Former Member of Faith-Healing Church Tells All
episodes.description:
–Linda Martin, former member of the Followers of Christ, a faith healing church in Idaho, joins David to discuss the Church and what can be done to stop the madness

episodes.title: Faith healing exemption hearing
episodes.description: A state legislative committee heard testimony this week on Idaho's faith healing exemption in cases of child neglect. Those testifying included Linda Martin, who wants to see the exemption removed, and Dan Sevy, a member of the church that practices faith healing as a treatment for the sick.

episodes.title: Special Report: A look at faith healing in Idaho
episodes.description: Roland Beres takes a look at faith healing in Idaho.
